header.gameNote: ATLANTIC SUN MEN'S CHAMPIONSHIP - QUARTERFINALS AT MACON GA

article.headline: Mercer 87, Belmont 81
article.story: MACON, Ga. -- Danny Emerson's three-point play with 5:26 remaining capped a second-half comeback and Mercer defeated Belmont 87-81 Thursday night in the Atlantic Sun Conference tournament quarterfinals. Sixth-seeded Mercer (15-16) plays Jacksonville on Friday night in the semifinals. Belmont, the third seed, held a double-digit lead most of the game and was ahead by 10 with 13:28 left when Mercer started its rally. Jeff Smith's 3-pointer gave Mercer its first lead with 4:15 remaining. Belmont pulled to within one a minute later, but the Bears were able to hold off the Bruins. Belmont led by 14 points in the first half, thanks to a 5-for-5 start in 3-point shots. Emerson, who missed the regular-season finale with an eye injury, started and scored 19 points with nine rebounds. James Florence led Mercer with 24. Ian Clark led Belmont (19-12) with 19.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
